issue.title: Refactor inference extension support to krt

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none

repository.name: istio
repository.description: Connect, secure, control, and observe services.

issue.body: We do this mainly by integrating it with the rest of the gateway controller. The conversion logic now has shadow inference services as an output we can query from pushcontext or whatever else.

body: Is that really a problem? With annotations I could imagine, but do we expect the user to make other changes, e.g. to the `Service` spec?

in the current implementation, we literally override everything with the controller spec. This is less for user-initiated changes, but more for controller initiated. If a controller adds an annotation, or a label for example, we completely discard it, when it is necessary to retain some times. 

>but do we expect the user to make other changes, e.g. to the Service spec?

For this, I believe we dont expect any.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Fixes #56667 by using Patch() instead of Update() for reconciling the shadow Service. I also refactored the test into the usual table-driven test format.
